newsitem.title: USA: Universal sees FY97 EPS about $2.40.
newsitem.headline: Universal sees FY97 EPS about $2.40.

text.p: Universal Corp said on Tuesday that its management forecasts that earnings for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1997 will be generally in line with analysts' current estimates of about $2.40 a share.
Universal Corp reported profits of $72.3 million, or $2.06 a share, on sales of $3.57 billion for the year ended June 1996.
Universal Corp, a company with operations in tobacco, lumber and agriculture, said quarterly comparisons in the year ended June 1997 will be difficult due to crop conditions and timings of shipments.
World markets continue to reflect growing cigarette consumption and strong leaf demand, Universal Corp said.
Universal said its non-tobacco businesses appear headed toward a record year.
In the company's first quarter, Universal said its domestic tobacco revenues and earnings were lower because of a delay in the harvest.
Foreign tobacco results improved dramatically in the quarter with major territories reporting operating gains, Universal said.
